probe_results.question: Which individual is repeatedly identified as the user's cofounder throughout the sessions?
retrieved_context: [Session llm-0, Time: 0] user: Good morning. I'm trying to get my head straight before the meeting with my cofounder later. assistant: Good morning. I hope you've had some coffee. What's on the agenda for the meeting with Sato? user: We need to finalize the architecture for the core platform. I keep forgetting if we settled on a single language or a mix. assistant: Looking at the latest technical specs for the CodeStream project, it looks like a hybrid stack. You're using Node.js for the API layer, but the heavy lifting is being handled by Rust. user: Right, that's it. Sato was really adamant about the performance benefits for the backend services. assistant: It seems like a solid choice to balance development speed with raw performance. user: Yeah. Totally unrelated, but can you remind me to pick up my dry cleaning at 5 PM? assistant: Sure thing, I've set a reminder for 5 PM to pick up the dry cleaning. user: Thanks. I'm having trouble connecting my tablet to the office network. Did we change the credentials? assistant: I don't believe they've changed recently. It should still be the company name, capitalized, followed by 2024 and an exclamation mark. user: Ah, I was missing the exclamation mark. That worked. assistant: Glad you got connected. Is there anything specific about the Node.js implementation you need to prep for the meeting? user: No, I think I'm good on the tech side. Just realized I skipped breakfast. assistant: You should probably grab something to eat before Sato arrives so you can focus. user: Good point. I'll grab a bagel. Talk to you later.

[Session llm-1, Time: 1] user: Hey, good morning. Did you catch the game last night? assistant: Good morning! I missed it, actually. I was offline most of the evening. How was it? user: It was intense. Anyway, I need to check the repo. My cofounder was complaining about compile times on the core module again. assistant: Ah, dealing with the borrow checker again? Rust is great for safety, but it definitely makes you wait during builds. user: Exactly. At least the API layer is faster to iterate on since it's just Node.js. assistant: True, that environment is much more forgiving for quick changes compared to the core logic. user: Yeah. Oh, by the way, I reset my phone and lost the saved networks. What's the office internet key again? assistant: It's pretty standard. Just our organization name, the current year, and an exclamation mark at the end. user: Got it, CodeStream2024! worked perfectly. Thanks. I also need to order lunch, you want anything? assistant: I'm good for now, maybe just a coffee later. Don't forget to push your changes before you eat. user: I won't. I'm just debugging a race condition real quick. assistant: Good luck with that. Let me know if you need me to look up any documentation.

[Session llm-5, Time: 5] user: Good morning, hope you're running smoothly today. assistant: Everything is operational here. Okay, switching gears, remind me to water the plants in the lobby when I get in. assistant: Consider it noted. I'll remind you to tend to the lobby plants when you arrive. user: Thanks. What's the wireless key again? assistant: For the CodeStream network, the password is the company name followed by 2024 and an exclamation mark. user: Got it, Capital C and S, right? assistant: Yes, standard capitalization for the name, ending with the year and the punctuation. user: Cool. Also, did I leave my jacket in the meeting room yesterday? assistant: I don't have access to camera feeds to check that, unfortunately. user: No worries, just checking. Alright, time to grab some coffee. Talk later.

probe_results.question: Is the CodeStream core project built exclusively using the Rust programming language?
probe_results.predicted_answer: No, the CodeStream core project is not built exclusively using the Rust programming language. It uses a hybrid setup with Rust for performance-critical components and Node.js for the general backend services.
